formalText: He has a habit and he can't remember but he thinks he's always maybe had this, and he thinks it probably comes from being so musical, but he has this OCD thing where he'll have to have some kind of Melody or just like a snippet of something.
He'll kind of sing it over and over again.
It doesn't really mean anything.
It's become like an OCD habit he thinks.
But it's very very frequent that it's maybe not OCD.
What happens is it goes through phases like a melody that will last for quite a while and then sometimes there will be some other things.
It's like a loop.
He thinks he's noticed about it that sometimes he does it in a manic way.
It's like a nervous habit.
He thinks it's just something he does when it's like a filler or something.
It's just like a little burst of energy.
It's never when he's sad.
It's never when he's angry or sad.
He's really just enjoying spending a lot of time alone.
He doesn't see a lot of his friends very often.
He's having less patience, so he just hangs around and makes conversation.
He needs his personal space and he doesn't want to be alone all the time, but a lot of the time he wants to be alone.
If he's walking down the street and he sees someone, they will just say shit. He'll just start saying shit to himself.
He'll start insulting them in Syrian.
He's not meaning any ill will, it just makes him feel better.
He doesn't want to see that woman's disgusting footwear, but he thinks it's a healthier kind of aggression in the sense of like he's not going to actually be upset, but he does need to make a joke.
It's almost like a protective shield because he can just say shh, and people don't know what he's saying.
And it makes him feel better.
It's almost like a coping thing.
